Who You’ll Work With:Stella is a team of people dedicated to advancing the understanding, destigmatization, and treatment of post-traumatic stress and other emotional trauma. We stay grounded in science, rooted in compassion, and are relentlessly committed to a world where no person needlessly suffers.We are a team of medical doctors, psychologists, patient care coordinators, and advocates committed to people's healing. We honor diversity and inclusivity, providing a space for all identities and backgrounds to show up each day as their authentic selves.We ask questions, challenge norms, confront inequities, push boundaries, and learn something new every day. At Stella, we continue to innovate like our lives depend on it -- because they do.What We Do:Those seeking relief deserve cutting-edge care. Stella is ushering in breakthrough treatments for trauma symptoms, stress, anxiety, and depression that are fast, effective, and backed by research.We are building the leading platform to connect those that have experienced PTSD or other emotional trauma with the most innovative and efficacious treatments, utilizing evidence-based pathways that relieve symptoms, all within a customized technology stack.The Stella platform is where people seeking trauma care can learn more about their condition, connect with others who understand what they’re feeling, and feel supported in finding the care that best meets their medical, financial, and practical needs.Stella’s core offering treats the symptoms of PTSD through a modification of a procedure called the Stellate Ganglion Block (SGB), a widely studied and highly effective procedure. SGB is just the beginning, as we are actively launching additional care modalities such as Ketamine, differentiated teletherapy, and many others. Our treatment program meets the needs before, during, and after treatment. This is the new model of trauma treatment. It’s what people in need of relief deserve.ABOUT THE ROLE:Stella is seeking a talented Business Data Analyst to join our collaborative and innovative team, whose core values are focused on leading every action with trust and kindness, taking bold action to transform emotional trauma, and earning respect through honesty and integrity. Our results are measured by the lives changed and trauma de-stigmatized, which should be at the forefront of our daily efforts.Reporting to the co-founder and Chief Financial & Strategy Officer, you will work across all teams within the business to develop and maintain all data functions, including managing the backend database hosted in AWS Redshift, creating/maintaining ETL scripts to pull in and clean data from external sources, and visualizing reports using Stella’s BI tool.This person will use insights pulled from data to directly influence all business functions, which include the full revenue lifecycle, including strategy, implementation, execution, and analysis of all paid and organic marketing efforts, network, and provider referral channels, and partnerships in pursuit of improving and optimizing patient acquisition and retention rates. The Business Data Analyst will also be pivotal in building out Stella’s medical outcomes to both demonstrate the efficacy of the company’s industry leading treatments and further its clinical protocols through data insights. This role is both analytical in nature, as well as strategic, as all analyses should directly relate to growing the business and helping mental trauma sufferers find relief from their worst symptoms. We expect our Business Data Analyst to understand the importance of community, the sensitivity of trauma, and the mission to eliminate needless suffering.Responsibilities:● Database ManagementStella currently maintains a PostgreSQL backend database hosted on AWS RedShift, where all data lives. The Business Data Analyst will take over sole control of this existing system, where data from external sources must be cleaned in order to power the front-end data visualization. Saved views written within RedShift will power BI downstream.● ETL ImplementationStella’s early-stage status means we are constantly onboarding new systems, whose data we must capture and analyze. The Business Data Analyst will continue pulling in these data sources via ETL tools like Stitch, Fivetran, and/or custom Python scripts.●Report Visualization AutomationStella currently uses a new BI tool called Holistics, where a complex system of datasets and dashboards are being used by different stakeholders across the business. The Business Data Analyst will take over maintenance of these dashboards, as well as create any new automated dashboards that need to be built.● Ad Hoc AnalysisThe Business Data Analyst will run ad-hoc analyses for teams across the business using existing/new datasets, often involving one-time Excel pulls & pivots.● Insights and RecommendationsThe Business Data Analyst will be empowered to present data informed recommendations to the C-Suite to drive the company forward.Qualifications: ● 3+ years of experience with SQL● Experience managing marketing & customer-funnel data● Experience with Python● Experience with AWS● Experience with Salesforce (UI and/or backend data structure)● Bachelor's Degree in Economics, CS, or a related degree● 1+ years of experience in the DTC and/or Healthcare industries● Comfortability presenting data to a variety of stakeholders, include C-Suite and Board executives● Creative problem solver with an eye for detail
